medical_history.chief_complaint: Upper abdominal bloating and pressure with LLQ pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior with LLQ and epigastric abdominal pain, constant and dull in nature, worsened with palpation. Patient also reports a new headache that is unilateral and more severe than previous migraines. Additionally, the patient experienced chills and nausea/vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: ANXIETY, DEPRESSION, GASTROESOPHAGEAL REFLUX, IRRITABLE BOWEL SYNDROME, MIGRAINE HEADACHES, OSTEOARTHRITIS, BACK PAIN, KIDNEY STONES, CTS, CERVICALGIA, REPEAT COLONOSCOPY, OBESITY, CHRONIC NECK/LOWER BACK PAIN.
